metadata.title: q_nnn412 | Q's Doghouse
metadata.description: An entrance to traces of thought

hero.tagline: An entrance to traces of thought
hero.description: Between technology and humanities, finding ways to understand the world.

blog.title: Blog
blog.subtitle: Thoughts may not be mature, but worth preserving
blog.description: What's presented here is the process of thinking, not conclusions or tutorials. Some articles may be incomplete, some views may be outdated, but still valuable for reference.

partner.title: Partner
partner.subtitle: The other side of life
partner.description:
{days} days, or {hours} hours when converted.

But what truly moves the heart has never been the numbers themselves,
but the moments strung together by them:

the first time we talked until dawn in a late-night cafe,
the first time we captured each other's most defenseless profiles on film,
the first time we walked hand-in-hand through the whole city in the cold wind,
and the first time we listened to the same song together, neither saying a word, just quietly shedding tears.

We never thought about writing love into an epic;
we just simply thought:
every day with you is worth being recorded well.

So just like that, day by day, it has accumulated into {days} days,
and also into the warmest title: 『{person2}』.
partner.quote: There is a person to experience daily life with.

friends.title: Friends
friends.subtitle: Who I stand with defines who I am
friends.description: Friend links are a form of 'decentralized self-introduction'. These are the people and sites I choose to resonate with.

journey.title: Journey
journey.subtitle: Trajectory of choices, shaped by curiosity rather than rigid paths.
journey.description: Each turn has its meaning; these scattered dots eventually pieced together who I am today.

silent.title: Finding Silence to Recalibrate
silent.content: During high school, the pressures of systems and expectations made me realize I didn't belong on the set tracks. I chose to step back and ask: 'If existing paths don't work, can I build my own?' In that near-blank silence, I buried myself in programming and model structures—not for school, but to reclaim choice over my own life.

turning.title: From User to Architect
turning.content: I decided not to take shortcuts. While others called APIs, I dove into DLLM (Diffusion LLM) papers. The denoising mechanisms and architectures fascinated me more than the tools themselves. I realized that what's scarce isn't users, but the courage to understand fundamentals. This marked my shift from self-taught to storyteller.

expansion.title: CEO of My Own Life
expansion.content: A declaration of learning autonomy. I started sharing deep tech content and growing a community to show that technology isn't just cold proof—it's a medium for dialogue. My story is still being written, and while it's slow, my coordinates are now crystal clear.

contact.title: Contact
contact.subtitle: If you want to continue the conversation, here I am
contact.description: No pressure to act, no implied promises.
contact.elsewhere: You can also find me here
